description: From Calicut, in India, from where the cloth was originally exported, from Malayalam കോഴിക്കോട് (kōḻikkōṭŭ, “Kozhikode”), from കോഴി (kōḻi, “palace”) + കോട് (kōṭŭ, “fortified palace”), with ‘y’ replaced by interchangeable ‘zh’.

entries.meaning: Made of calico or resembling the color of calico cloth, having a pattern of red and contrasting areas; variegated.
examples: The calico cat had distinctive red and dark markings.
The calico-patterned tablecloths were supposed to make the restaurant look rustic; instead, they made it look run down.

nouns.description: calico (countable and uncountable, plural calicos or calicoes)

entries.meaning: (textiles) A kind of rough cloth made from unbleached and not fully processed cotton, often printed with a bright pattern.
(uncountable) The plant disease caused by Tobacco mosaic virus.
